required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Utilizing the Arts to Improve Health, Resilience, and Well-Being Among Cancer Patients and Their Caregivers
clinical_study.official_title: Utilizing the Arts to Improve Health, Resilience, and Well-Being in Individuals With Cancer and Their Caregivers: A Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the impact of arts-based programming on health, well-being, and resilience. Patients who have cancer or are the caregivers of someone with cancer are being asked to take part in this study.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective:
Primary:
To assess the feasibility and acceptability of arts-based programming for community-dwelling cancer survivors and caregivers. Feasibility and acceptability will be assessed based on:
1. Recruitment
2. Participation
3. Retention (drop-outs)
4. Satisfaction
Secondary:
To assess the participants' ability to:
1. Define goals and strategies using the contents of the program.
2. Implement the strategies in their daily activities in the short-term.
3. Continue to use these strategies after the program ends.
Exploratory:
To perform exploratory analyses on the impact of arts-based programming on health, resilience, and well-being.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This will be a pre-post intervention observational study utilizing a mixed methods approach

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Number of participants recruited in the study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks after beginning of study
primary_outcome.description: Study will be feasible if recruitment goal is met with 10-20 participants enrolled

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility: Average number of session attended by participants
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks after beginning of study
primary_outcome.description: Study will be feasible if average number of session attended will be greater than or equal to 4

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of patients who drop out of study
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks after beginning of study
primary_outcome.description: Study will be feasible if no more than 25% of patients drop out of study

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 8 weeks after beginning of study
primary_outcome.description: Satisfaction will be high in post-test surveys

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Impact of arts-based programming on health
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks after final session (11 weeks from beginning of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of program on health described in phenomenological interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Impact of arts based programming on resilience
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks after final session (11 weeks from beginning of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of program on resilience described in phenomenological interviews

secondary_outcome.measure: Qualitative Impact of arts based programming on well-being
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 3 weeks after final session (11 weeks from beginning of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of program on well-being described in phenomenological interviews

arm_group.arm_group_label: arts-based programming for cancer survivors and caregivers
arm_group.description: This is a 8-week, arts-based, health, resilience, and well-being program.

intervention.description: This feasibility study includes educational components and an experiential components which are assessed with pre- and post-tests. The topics of these components include: Introduction to the Arts and Health; Music, Well-Being, and Resilience; Movement and Physical Activity; Art and Well-Being; Theater and Socialization; Art Appreciation and a Healthy Brain; and Summary/Integration of the Arts into Daily Lives. The impact of this program will be assessed with qualitative follow-up interviews.
intervention.arm_group_label: arts-based programming for cancer survivors and caregivers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to participate in all program sessions
- Cognitively able to consent to participate
- Speaks, reads, and writes English
- Diagnosis of cancer or caregiver of someone with cancer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe visual or auditory impairment
- Severe and/or uncontrolled comorbidity precluding safe participation in a physical activity program

overall_official.affiliation: Cleveland Clinic, Case Comprehensive Cancer Center

facility.name: Cleveland Clinic, Case Comprehensive Cancer Center
